Package doa.engine.net

Class DoaClient

java.lang.Object
doa.engine.net.DoaClient
public class DoaClient
extends java.lang.Object
A barebones wrapper for Socket and it's desired functionality.

In order to create and connect a client, and communicate with it refer to the code segment below. 
 
 DoaClient cl = new DoaClient(); // create a client instance
 try {
    // try to connect to 159.10.210.199:27015
    cl.connect("159.10.210.199", port); // a server at 159.10.210.199 must be listening at the port 27015
    // an invoke to connect will block until a connection is made
    // or an error occurs, like a connection timeout
 } catch (UnknownHostException ex) {
    // if connection fails, handle it
 }
 cl.send(new DoaNetPacket<>("HELLO")); // send a packet containing the string "HELLO"
 cl.disconnect(); // disconnect form the server
Since:
DoaEngine 3.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
Doga Oruc

  • Field Details

    • socket

      protected java.net.Socket socket
      The instance of socket connected to server. This socket exists when the object is instantiated. The socket is connected to a server when a call to connect(String, int) returns successfully.

    • input

      protected java.io.ObjectInputStream input
      Input stream used to receive data from the server.

    • output

      protected java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
      Output stream used to send data to the server.

    • id

      protected int id
      The unique ID of this socket, appointed by the server upon a successful connection.

    • q

      protected java.util.Queue<DoaNetPacket<java.io.Serializable>> q

  • Constructor Details

    • DoaClient

      public DoaClient()
      Constructor

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect​(java.lang.String ipAddress, int port) throws java.net.UnknownHostException
      Connects to a server. This method blocks until a connection has been made or an error occurs.
      Parameters:
      ipAddress - IP Address of the server
      port - port in which the server is listening on
      Throws:
      java.net.UnknownHostException - thrown when an error occurs while trying to connect, most common case is a connection timeout

    • send

      public void send​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaNetPacket<java.io.Serializable> packet)
      Sends a packet of data to the connected server. A connection must exist prior to a call to this method, otherwise this method will throw an IllegalStateException.
      Parameters:
      packet - data to send
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if isConnected() returns false

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the server. Prior to a call to this method, a connection must exist, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if isConnected() returns false

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Returns the connection state of the client.
      Returns:
      true if and only if client is already connected to a server and the connection has not been ended yet, otherwise false

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Returns:
      the unique ID of this client, appointed by the Server it is connected to; or -1, if no connection has been made so far

    • onConnect

      @ForOverride protected void onConnect()
      Invoked upon a successful connection. Upon entering this method, the client is ready to send and receive messages from the Server.

    • onReceive

      @ForOverride protected void onReceive​(DoaNetPacket<java.io.Serializable> packet)
      Invoked upon the retrieval of data from the Server.
      Parameters:
      packet - data coming from the server

    • onDisconnect

      @ForOverride protected void onDisconnect()
      Invoked upon a successful disconnection. Upon entering this method, the client has already disconnected from the Server.
